The flush is my strongest option here. With five diamonds, I can form a flush that scores all eight cards through Splash. The flush base gives 50 chips and 6 mult at Level 2, but every card in hand contributes—the Q♠, 7♠, and K♣ add their chip values while the diamond cards form the flush itself, creating significant scoring potential.

Adding up all contributions: the non-flush cards contribute 27 chips total, while the five diamonds in the flush add 26 chips, bringing me to 103 chips before multipliers. At 6x mult, that's 618 chips—nowhere near the 3000 I need.

However, if I can trigger Mystic Summit by using zero discards, I'd gain an additional 15 mult, pushing the total to 21x. That would yield 2,163 chips, still falling short of my goal.

I should explore other hand combinations. A three of a kind with Queens looks promising—I have two Queens and need just one more from the remaining 37 cards. If I land it, Zany Joker would contribute 12 mult. With all eight cards scoring via Splash, I'd have 113 chips multiplied by 32x (5 base + 12 from Zany + 15 from Mystic Summit), giving me 3,616 chips.

I could play the flush now for 618 chips and still have hands left to build on that, or I could use my 5 remaining discards to hunt for another Queen. The math suggests chasing the three of a kind is worth the risk—I need roughly 3,000 total chips, and this combo gets me there if I hit the Queen.

With 3 Queens left in 37 cards, discarding 5 non-essential cards gives me about a 31% chance of drawing at least one. I'll keep the diamond flush as insurance and discard the 7♠ and K♣ to improve my odds without sacrificing my backup plan.

Since the flush only yields 618 chips without Mystic Summit, I should focus on getting three Queens instead. My approach: use 4 more discards hunting for that third Queen while holding back 1 discard to delay Mystic Summit activation. If I hit three Queens, I'll use my final discard to trigger Mystic Summit before playing. Otherwise, I'll burn remaining discards to activate it and play whatever hand is strongest.

I'm discarding the 7♠, K♣, and both 3♦s since none of them can improve my hand.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.
